construct.title: Gasifier Burner
construct.description: The Gasifier Burner converts biomass fuel into power and useful chemicals.
construct.tip: This is achieved by reacting the material at high temperatures (>700Â°C), without combustion, with a controlled amount of oxygen and/or steam, breaking down the biomass into carbon monoxide, hydrogen, carbon dioxide and methane. The resulting gas mixture is a fuel called syngas. If Air is used in place of oxygen the gas also contains inert nitrogen and is called producer gas.
